text:
Hello developers!

The `dnd_area` syntax that supports the new drag-and-drop page editing experience is out of beta and available to all accounts! Drag and drop areas represent the future of how marketer-friendly websites are built on the HubSpot CMS, while allowing developers to utilize coded files, and the tools and technologies they prefer.

To get started building using drag and drop areas, follow the getting started guide here <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/drag-and-drop-areas>. You can also check out the <#CMXUWUY5D|hs-cms-boilerplate> templates, which utilize this syntax <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/master/src/templates>

As always, please send any feedback along in <#CDU990ECW|drag-n-drop-pages> or to myself!

I have a couple of announcements bundled into one post for you all here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/HubSpot-php-client-library-v2-is-now-available-and-two-new-node.js-example-apps>

This is an exciting announcement with some great new resources, the highlight of which is a new major version of the popular community support client library for PHP!  Let us know if you have any questions or comments
